title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil contains a line of code: `static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, 'windowProc', 4)`, where `BidiUtil.class` is syntactic sugar for `Class.forName('org...BidiUtil')`. This code throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is not defined in the CLDC class libraries. As a result, there is an issue in the CLDC version of SWT. This problem can only be observed if jxeLink or a similar tool is used, as the compiler automatically generates the call and assumes NoClassDefFoundError is available.
EB: The usage of `Class.forName()` in BidiUtil should be changed to remove the reflection.
SR: To reproduce the issue, verify or use jxeLink (or a similar tool) with the CLDC version of SWT.
